question: You have recently missed a project deadline which resulted in your company losing an important client. Write a letter to your manager. In your letter• apologise for what happened• explain why you missed the deadline• tell him/her how you will avoid this situation in future.
text: I am writing this letter about the project which I was lost due to some reasons. Firstly, I apologize for a missed contract that was extremely crucial for our company business.

In short, I worked hard on this assignment for three months and I had stored my all progress on this project on my company laptop. Besides this, I also prepared the artificial model of this new product which I have to discuss with our delegate party. However, last Saturday, unfortunately, my room was spiked by fire due to a short circuit. Consequently, my whole preparation was damaged in this firebreak.

I will ensure it will not happen again in the future as next time I will always try to keep another copy of every project online to avoid this kind of situation. I hope you understand my consequences.
